p: The only large detailed on-farm study of the effects of drought on cocoa is of an experimentally imposed drought on six-year old cocoa grown with six-year old Gliricidia shade in Indonesia [ 30â€“ 34]. The c. 78% rainfall exclusion over 13 months (of about 3000 mm rain in that period) caused only a 10% loss in cocoa yield during the rainfall exclusion, though a further 45% reduction was recorded after the end of the drought; no cocoa tree mortality was observed.
